assessment.title: Anatomy and Direction of the Respiratory System

question.body: When you inhale, your rib cage moves away from the coronal and transverse planes in which directions?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Inferior means toward the inside, not outward.

Correct. When you breathe air into your body, the rib cage moves away from the coronal plane towards the front, referred to as the anterior of the body, and away from the transverse plane towards the upper, also called the superior, area of the body.
Incorrect. Deep means inward from the skin.
Incorrect. Posterior means towards the back of the body.

no_response.feedback: Please try to answer the question.

part.hint: Take a breath and watch where your ribs go.
